channel.title: Freaking help me!
channel.description:
I've posted this in the compiling problem section, yet no one has replied to it with an answer. Any-how, I can't compile because it says that it cannot find the correct path. It is a 508 source, and I do know that you need a different JDK path, but I don't know which one, so if someone could PM it to me, or reply to this topic, you'd be doing me a huge favor. Thank-you for reading, and hopefully replying with any answer/ tips.
~ Abcpker711/ Kevin. (P.S. I'M ABOUT TO LOSE MY DAMN MIND!)

item.title: Freaking help me!
item.dc:creator: @dragon39990 dragon39990
item.description:
@dragon39990 wrote:

abcpker711:

Thank-you! You are the man, and anytime that you wish to join, PrestigeCode, just register at PrestigeCode.com, and I hope you know that I love you, and you can be a Staff member anytime! Have a nice night, and grats on becoming an awesome person!

thats what I was trying to get you to do lol
—explanation—
Your compiler was trying to get jdk _12 but you don’t have JDK _12 you have JDK _20, so you only had to make it search the right file.

Read full topic

item.title: Freaking help me!
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

@echo off Title Berky-Scape Compiler cd .. "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java pause change it to that.

Read full topic

item.title: Freaking help me!
item.dc:creator: @abcpker711 abcpker711
item.description:
@abcpker711 wrote:

This is the one that I’m using, only because I put it there manually. It’s not right tho, so this is the current JDK: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;…

This is what it says I need to use, when I right click the Compile.Exe, and click edit, this is what it says: @echo off
Title Berky-Scape Compiler
cd …
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_12\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./Bulby/./io/*.java
pause

And sorry for getting pissy. :[

Read full topic

Example: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin; <- is what my environment variables are atm. Still won’t let me compile!

Tell me what Variables I need. And what I need to download, it’s that simple.
